name: BIRD OPENING
idea: The Reversed Dutch with an extra tempo! White controls e5 and prepares a kingside attack with Nf3, g3, Bg2, 0-0, d3 then e4 or a direct attack with Nc3 and e4. It's an original opening that avoids all classical theory. The price? The White King is slightly weakened (e1-h4 diagonal) and Black can counter-attack with the From Gambit (1...e5!?). Perfect to surprise!
errors_white: Playing f4 then forgetting to control e5: Black can settle a Knight on e5
Pushing e4 without preparation: can weaken the f4 pawn
Neglecting development: the opening is slow, don't fall behind
errors_black: Being passive: ...d5 and ...c5 must fight for the center
Ignoring the From Gambit (1...e5): it's an interesting option to know
Letting White fianchetto without opposition: ...Nf6, ...d6, ...e5 can be effective
development: Controls e5 and prepares the attack - it's the signature move
Nf3 classical - develops and supports e5
g3 then Bg2 - fianchetto as in Dutch
Fast kingside castle to secure the King
Solid - prepares e4 or Nc3 according to the plan
Thematic move for a strong center - careful with timing

traps.name: From Gambit
traps.desc: 1...e5!? From Gambit - pawn sacrifice! After 2.fxe5 d6 3.exd6 Bxd6 Black has open lines and activity. AVOID (White): Accept with fxe5 but play solidly, or decline with e4.

traps.name: Diagonal Trap
traps.desc: After ...d5 ...e6, if White plays b3?! ...Bb4+! can be annoying since the King hasn't castled. AVOID (White): Play g3/Bg2/0-0 quickly to secure the King.

traps.name: Leningrad Trap
traps.desc: Leningrad System: g3, Bg2, Nf3, 0-0, d3. If Black plays ...Bd6?! the Bishop blocks d6 and hinders development. AVOID (Black): Play ...Be7 (solid) or ...c5 for counterplay.

variants.name: Leningrad System
variants.uci: f2f4 d7d5 g1f3 g8f6 g2g3 g7g6 f1g2 f8g7 e1g1 e8g8
variants.white_plan: Double fianchetto possible. d3, Nc3 or c4 to attack d5. The position resembles a reversed King's Indian.
variants.black_plan: Mirror fianchetto. ...c5 or ...c6 to support d5. ...Nc6 or ...Nbd7. Symmetrical and solid play.

variants.name: From Gambit Accepted
variants.uci: f2f4 e7e5 f4e5 d7d6 e5d6 f8d6 g1f3 g7g5
variants.white_plan: Black has sacrificed a pawn for activity. Develop with d4, Nc3, e3 and consolidate the extra pawn.
variants.black_plan: Attack! ...g4 chases the Nf3, ...Nc6, ...Qe7, ...Be6. The initiative compensates for the pawn.

variants.name: Classical Variation
variants.uci: f2f4 d7d5 g1f3 g8f6 e2e3 e7e6 f1e2 c7c5 e1g1 b8c6
variants.white_plan: Reversed Stonewall type position. b3, Bb2, Ne5 or d3 and c4. Control e5 and attack on the kingside.
variants.black_plan: Central counterplay with ...c5. ...Bd6, ...0-0, ...b6/...Bb7. Look for ...Ne4 or ...d4 to open up.
